content:
Is there any guidance on adding to the Observation categorized notes such as

  • [tech note]: this exam is not covered by accreditation
  • [clinical note]: this exam may be affected by medications...
    (sorry for poor examples - but I hope the idea is clear)
@Rob Hausam @Ralf Herzog
(not sure whom to ask)
I want to add an extension(?) that provides categorized notes - i.e. a note(text?) with a coded type
wondering if this has already been seen somewhere
@Jose Costa Teixeira - #genomics is working on something just like this in our IG. I or @Patrick Werner can provide more details soon
thanks @Kevin Power
do you know where the genomics IG is?
We have a branch with our proposal - http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/pw-codedNotes/StructureDefinition-coded-annotation.html
Hopefully you can start there. (Sorry but I am out and about and am only on my phone)
Hi @Jose Costa Teixeira yes i created an extension for this purpose (the one Kevin linked)
Nice, so you extend the data type
yes
i'm not sure if I should use it just because it's not yet official.. otherwise I make my own
we then just changed the target profile of DR.note

Jose Costa Teixeira said:

i'm not sure if I should use it just because it's not yet official.. otherwise I make my own

understandable. I wish this was part of the core spec (even as extension)
created a Jira Ticket about it in R3: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-22102?jql=project%3D%22FHIR%22%20AND%20text~%22coded%20annotation%22

vote was on a later duplicate: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-29705
(non persuasive)

@Grahame Grieve @Lloyd McKenzie
i can understand your points in the resolution. But now different people are starting to create similar Extensions to solve this problem.
Maybe at least a core extension would be an option to prevent wild extension growth.
actually I think my need is somewhere on Observation, but the requirement seems the same
you are right. We needed it on both.
so we're looking at a "TypedAnnotation" data type, that contains that extension?
We called it "CodedAnnotation", but yes.
@Jose Costa Teixeira I'm coming to this late. Has this answered your original question?
Yes
I do think it should be a standard extension
I would prefer they be a Resource that points at the Observation it is commenting on.
@John Moehrke wrong thread? This is about mapping NTE-4 by adding an annotation type to Annotation
